sentence.intro: is a project designed to let you
sentence.experience: live the experience of disabled personas
sentence.in-shoe: through interactive simulations. By putting yourself in their shoes, you will discover
sentence.sensibilize: sensibilize to the importance of accessibility for a more inclusive web.

objective-card.title: Goal
objective-card.description: You need to go shopping to bake an apple cake. Here is what you will need to buy:

shopping-list.title: Add to your cart
shopping-list.body: An apple, some wheat flour and an egg

color-blindness.title: Color-blindness
color-blindness.body: You are currently viewing the page as a color-blind user might see it.  Color blindness is a vision anomaly that prevents your user from perceiving certain colors. There are several types of color blindness; here you see the page under a protanopia spectrum (the user does not detect the color red), but some users may not perceive green, blue or any of the three colors. An estimated 45 out of 1000 people are color-blind. To ensure that your site can be used by people suffering from color blindness, remember to check on your applications that the information is not conveyed solely by images.

parkinson.title: Parkinson
parkinson.body: Here, we've tried to give you a glimpse of what a user suffering from Parkinson's disease might experience. The disease is associated with motor symptoms, such as the tremors we've simulated. It is estimated that one person in 1000 suffers from the symptoms of this disease. To help these users, use large buttons and links, and check that keyboard navigation is possible.

attention-deficit.title: Attention deficit
attention-deficit.body: Here, we've tried to simulate what a person with ADD might experience when browsing the site you're developing. In France, it is estimated that around 25 out of every 1,000 adults suffer from attention deficit disorders. To help these users, remember to give only the information that is strictly necessary, so as not to further confuse your users' thoughts.

dyslexia.title: Dyslexia
dyslexia.body: This page can give you an idea of what it's like for someone with dyslexia. Dyslexia is a reading disorder that affects between 2.5% and 16% of the population. If you want to make navigation easier for your users, create components with plenty of space, and pay attention to the typography you use.

success.title: Congratulations,
success.subtitle: you managed to order the ingredients for your apple pie.
